intro: Varronia paucidentata var. subulata, commonly known as the slender-leaved varronia, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, pointed leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
